Package com.doa.ui.button

Class DoaImageButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.doa.engine.DoaObject
      • com.doa.ui.DoaUIComponent
        • com.doa.ui.button.DoaButton
          • com.doa.ui.button.DoaImageButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class DoaImageButton
extends DoaButton
    A button that can render DoaSprites onto itself. When hovered over, renders hoverImage onto itself. When clicked, renders clickImage onto itself. Else, renders idleImage.
    Since:
    DoaEngine 2.3
    Version:
    2.4
    Author:
    Doga Oruc
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • DoaImageButton

        public DoaImageButton​(java.lang.Float x,
                      java.lang.Float y,
                      java.lang.Integer width,
                      java.lang.Integer height,
                      java.awt.image.BufferedImage idleImage)
        Instantiates a button with the bounds and action.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the top left corner of the UI component
        y - y coordinate of the top left corner of the UI component
        width - width of the UI component
        height - height of the UI component
        idleImage - sprite that will be rendered onto this button when the button is idle, cannot be null

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render​(DoaGraphicsContext g)
        Description copied from class: DoaObject
        This method is required to be public, but should never be called explicitly by any class at any time except DoaEngine. If done otherwise, DoaEngine provides no guarantees on the quality and consistency of rendering. All draw calls regarding a DoaObject's internal state must be executed inside this method. This method is always executed on time.
        Specified by:
        render in class DoaObject
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context of DoaEngine
